skillTree.name: Hates Nurgle
skillTree.description: Perhaps it is the Fly Lord's apparent nonchalance that enrages Tzeentch so? Whatever the reason, the Great Game's greatest player, and his greatest servant, have an adversary on which to focus their ire.

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 when fighting against Nurglish factions
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Nurglish factions
Ability: "Gaze of Fate"

skillTree.name: Invulnerable Through Change
skillTree.description: With just a wave of the hand, projectiles fired at this servant of Tchar are turned from sharp and pointy to soft and entirely harmless.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10%
Ability: "Hidden in Time"
Barrier: +40% during battles
Ability: "Oracle of Eternity"

skillTree.name: The Oracle
skillTree.description: Fateweaver may harness the Winds of Magic to his best advantage, for he already knows all the possible outcomes of his actions.

effects.description: Chance of Winds of Magic increasing in strength when changing: +10%
Miscast base chance: -40%

skillTree.name: Thaumaturgic Rejuvenation
skillTree.description: Though all who serve the Changer are gifted with additional protection from attack, some can restore it to maximum effectiveness faster than others.

effects.description: Barrier replenishment delay: -25%
Barrier replenishment rate: +25%

skillTree.name: Irridescent Scriveners
skillTree.description: Kairos' scribes faithfully record every baleful whisper that passes his lips, that they be made real, in the form of the Daemonic Horrors that do his bidding.

effects.description: Hero action success chance: +20% for Iridescent Horrors
Hero recruit rank: +3 for Iridescent Horrors
Tzeentch corruption: +2
Attribute: Causes Terror for embedded Iridescent Horror Heroes

skillTree.name: Boons of Change
skillTree.description: Of all the gifts bestowed by the Dark Powers upon their followers, the boons of Tzeentch are surely the most desirable.

effects.description: Barrier: +20% for Lord of Change units
Winds of Magic cost: -15% for Lore of Tzeentch spells

skillTree.name: Bewitching Potency
skillTree.description: Enchantments such as these may be strengthened further by those with the requisite magical skill.

effects.description: Barrier: +20% during battles
Attribute: Mastery of the Elemental Winds for Iridescent Horrors, Cultists and Lords of Change
Overcast spell: "Blue Fire of Tzeentch Upgraded"

ui_effects.description: Requires line of sight to the target
Requires line of sight to the target

effects.description: Cooldown: -30% to "Blue Fire of Tzeentch"
Overcast spell: "Blue Fire of Tzeentch Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Magical Reserves
skillTree.description: A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve change: +20% when increasing

skillTree.name: Earthing
skillTree.description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.

effects.description: Miscast base chance: -15%
Passive ability: "Greater Arcane Conduit"

skillTree.name: Inspiring Presence
skillTree.description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description: Unit experience gain per turn: +75
Character's aura leadership effect: +5

skillTree.name: Accursed Horrors
skillTree.description: Though they may appear ridiculous, the whirling, screeching footsoldiers of the Great Conspirator are the iron in his feathered martial glove.

effects.description: Missile strength: +8% for Blue Horrors of Tzeentch, Pink Horrors of Tzeentch and Exalted Pink Horrors of Tzeentch units
Barrier: +5% for Blue Horrors of Tzeentch, Pink Horrors of Tzeentch and Exalted Pink Horrors of Tzeentch units
Missile strength: +12% for Blue Horrors of Tzeentch, Pink Horrors of Tzeentch and Exalted Pink Horrors of Tzeentch units
Barrier: +10% for Blue Horrors of Tzeentch, Pink Horrors of Tzeentch and Exalted Pink Horrors of Tzeentch units
Missile strength: +16% for Blue Horrors of Tzeentch, Pink Horrors of Tzeentch and Exalted Pink Horrors of Tzeentch units

skillTree.name: Myriad Servants
skillTree.description: Although it can be said that they have failed His tests, the broken minds and fluctuating, mutated bodies of Tzeen'neth's lesser minions still have their uses.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Chaos Furies, Screamers of Tzeentch, Forsaken of Tzeentch and Spawn of Tzeentch units
Speed: +10% for Chaos Furies and Screamers of Tzeentch units
Melee attack: +4 for Chaos Furies, Screamers of Tzeentch, Forsaken of Tzeentch and Spawn of Tzeentch units
Charge bonus: +6 for Forsaken of Tzeentch and Spawn of Tzeentch units
Speed: +15% for Chaos Furies and Screamers of Tzeentch units
Melee attack: +6 for Chaos Furies, Screamers of Tzeentch, Forsaken of Tzeentch and Spawn of Tzeentch units
Charge bonus: +8 for Forsaken of Tzeentch and Spawn of Tzeentch units

skillTree.name: Many-Coloured Fires
skillTree.description: Unburdened by mass, Tzeentch's flaming servants surge toward the foe – the heralds of their utter doom, no less.

effects.description: Missile strength: +4% for Flamers of Tzeentch and Exalted Flamer of Tzeentch units
Range: +5% for Flamers of Tzeentch, Exalted Flamer of Tzeentch and Burning Chariot of Tzeentch units
Missile strength: +6% for Flamers of Tzeentch and Exalted Flamer of Tzeentch units
Range: +10% for Flamers of Tzeentch, Exalted Flamer of Tzeentch and Burning Chariot of Tzeentch units
Missile strength: +8% for Flamers of Tzeentch and Exalted Flamer of Tzeentch units

skillTree.name: Riders of Change
skillTree.description: The thundering of their Chaos Steeds and chariots announces the arrival of Kaldour's dread Knights, and death is never far behind them.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +8% for Chaos Knights of Tzeentch and Doom Knights of Tzeentch units
Weapon strength: +12% for Chaos Knights of Tzeentch and Doom Knights of Tzeentch units
Charge bonus: +12% for Chaos Knights of Tzeentch and Doom Knights of Tzeentch units
Weapon strength: +16% for Chaos Knights of Tzeentch and Doom Knights of Tzeentch units
Charge bonus: +18% for Chaos Knights of Tzeentch and Doom Knights of Tzeentch units

skillTree.name: Warped Retainers
skillTree.description: For the Winged Watchers and Doomstriders of this world, their very lack of identifiable corporeal form shall be their armour against attack.

effects.description: Armour: +6 for Lord of Change and Soul Grinder of Tzeentch units
Armour: +9 for Lord of Change and Soul Grinder of Tzeentch units
Melee attack: +4 for Lord of Change and Soul Grinder of Tzeentch units
Armour: +12 for Lord of Change and Soul Grinder of Tzeentch units
Melee attack: +6 for Lord of Change and Soul Grinder of Tzeentch units
Passive ability: "Seer of Destiny"

skillTree.name: Horrific Advancement
skillTree.description: Even the bravest, most rational souls waver in the hideous, laughing face of their worst nightmares.

effects.description: Leadership: +6 for Blue Horrors of Tzeentch, Pink Horrors of Tzeentch and Exalted Pink Horrors of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
Speed: +10% for Blue Horrors of Tzeentch, Pink Horrors of Tzeentch and Exalted Pink Horrors of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
Missile resistance: 15% for Blue Horrors of Tzeentch, Pink Horrors of Tzeentch and Exalted Pink Horrors of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.name: Arsenal of Insanity
skillTree.description: Of the many weapons available to Tchar, derangement must surely be the greatest and most satsifying to wield.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +12% for Forsaken of Tzeentch, Spawn of Tzeentch, Lord of Change and Soul Grinder units (Rank 7 and above)
Bonus vs Infantry: +6 for Forsaken of Tzeentch, Spawn of Tzeentch, Lord of Change and Soul Grinder units (Rank 7 and above)
Spell resistance: 15% for Forsaken of Tzeentch, Spawn of Tzeentch, Lord of Change and Soul Grinder units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.name: Incendiary Ascent
skillTree.description: The flickering beings of flame are in many ways the purest servants of the Changer, for their gaseous forms are ever in a state of flux.

effects.description: Leadership: +6 for Flamers of Tzeentch, Exalted Flamer of Tzeentch and Burning Chariot of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
Weapon strength: +24% for Flamers of Tzeentch, Exalted Flamer of Tzeentch and Burning Chariot of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
Spell resistance: 15% for Flamers of Tzeentch, Exalted Flamer of Tzeentch and Burning Chariot of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.name: Armour of Delirium
skillTree.description: The best form of defence is attack, and the best form of attack is the one which reaches into the foe's mind and turns its contents against them.

effects.description: Armour: +12 for Chaos Knights of Tzeentch, Doom Knights of Tzeentch, Chaos Furies and Screamers of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
Leadership: +6 for Chaos Knights of Tzeentch, Doom Knights of Tzeentch, Chaos Furies and Screamers of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
Missile resistance: 15% for Chaos Knights of Tzeentch, Doom Knights of Tzeentch, Chaos Furies and Screamers of Tzeentch units (Rank 7 and above)
Replaces: "Seer of Destiny"
Passive ability: "Master of Fates"

skillTree.name: Route Marcher
skillTree.description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +5%

skillTree.name: Reckoning of Transmogrification
skillTree.description: Who pays the piper? Why, Fateweaver's opponents, of course, with their minds and souls as coins of currency.

effects.description: Changing of the Ways cost: -3%
Changing of the Ways cost: -6%
Changing of the Ways cost: -9%

skillTree.name: Control Through Confusion
skillTree.description: Those who cannot think clearly and lucidly are unable to resist the insidious creep of Ruin.

effects.description: Control: +1
Control: +2
Control: +3

skillTree.name: Elementals of Surprise
skillTree.description: Surprise is half the battle. The other half is pure, unadulterated terror in the face of certain madness.

effects.description: Ambush success chance: +10%
Ambush success chance: +20%
Ambush success chance: +30%

skillTree.name: Binding of the Wills
skillTree.description: Having effected Change upon one's enemies, what next for the Mocking Watcher? More of the same, naturally, for to do so over and over again brings the sweetest of raptures.

effects.description: Changing of the Ways cooldown: -1 turns
Changing of the Ways cooldown: -2 turns
Changing of the Ways cooldown: -3 turns

skillTree.name: Lightning Strike
skillTree.description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enemy battle reinforcement time: +25%
Enemy battle reinforcement time: +50%
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Enemy battle reinforcement time: +50%

skillTree.name: Called by Change
skillTree.description: The promise of Change, though it may amount to nothing more than the cruellest of tricks, ensures the forces of Tzeen'neth are fed and nourished.

effects.description: Upkeep: -3%
Upkeep: -6%
Upkeep: -9%

skillTree.name: All Intents & Purposes
skillTree.description: When you know all there is to know, as does Kairos, nothing is beyond the reach of your grasp.

effects.description: Changing of the Ways cost: -100% for "Reveal Faction Intentions"

skillTree.name: Scrolls of Destiny
skillTree.description: The many faces of the Wind-lord are described here, along with all the terrible mysteries of destiny. Between these lines lurks insanity, ever waiting to trap the unwary.

effects.description: Grimoires: 1 per turn
Grimoires: 2 per turn
Grimoires from all buildings: +50%
Grimoires: 3 per turn
Grimoires from all buildings: +100%

skillTree.name: Legions of Madness
skillTree.description: Tzeentch knows that at their cores all beings desire Change, and as such there are no shortage of recruits willing to march under his many-coloured banner.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +2%
Casualty replenishment rate: +4%
Casualty replenishment rate: +6%

skillTree.name: Renowned & Feared
skillTree.description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Upkeep: -8%
Campaign movement range: +5%
Enemy Hero action success chance: -10%
Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors
Recruit rank: +1

backgroundSkills.name: Oracle
backgroundSkills.description: "The now is trivial to us – we know the day we perish is not this day."

effects.description: Can unlock unique items that can be used to customise Kairos' spell selection
Enemy Hero action success chance: -50%
Ambush defence chance: +50%
Spell: "Blue Fire of Tzeentch"

ui_effects.description: Requires line of sight to the target

effects.description: Spell: "Pink Fire of Tzeentch"
Winds of Magic cost: -25% for all spells
Tzeentch corruption: +3
Melee defence: +5
Cooldown: -25% to spells
Winds of Magic power reserve change: +20% when increasing
Ward save: 12%
Barrier hit points: +500
Tzeentch corruption: +3
Changing of the Ways cooldown: -1 turns
Changing of the Ways cost: -10%

items.name: Arcane Helm of Kairos
items.description: After emerging from the Well of Eternity, Kairos was awarded a golden helmet from Tzeentch.  Since he is blind to the present, Kairos is vulnerable to attack and wears his majestic helm when venturing into the realm of mortals.

items.name: Bracelet of the Old Ones
items.description: A golden bracelet covered with mysterious symbols and a variety of precious stones.  It was once worn by an Old One, and the air around the piece of jewelry shimmers and hums.  It is doubtful any mortal would survive wearing the artefact.

effects.description: Hero capacity: +1 for Cultists
Hero recruit rank: +1 for Cultists
Tzeentch corruption: +5
Miscast base chance: -15%
Ability: "Staff of Tomorrow"

items.name: Staff of Tomorrow
items.description: Kairos lives apart from the flow of time. Thus, he does not easily succumb to ill-fortune, for fate can easily be altered if one has the proper knowledge.

items.name: Grimoire of Change
items.description: The casing of this book is made from an unknown metallic material that seems to be in constant motion.  Sometimes the surface is blurry and vibrating, but other times the tome is growing or shrinking.  Surely, nothing sane could decipher the secrets contained within.
